verses.plain: The transgression of the wicked saith within my heart, that there is no fear of God before his eyes.

tokens.t: The transgression of the wicked saith within my heart,
no fear of God before his eyes.

verses.plain: For he flattereth himself in his own eyes, until his iniquity be found to be hateful.

tokens.t: For he flattereth himself in his own eyes, until his iniquity be found to be hateful.

verses.plain: The words of his mouth are iniquity and deceit: he hath left off to be wise, and to do good.

tokens.t: The words of his mouth
iniquity and deceit: he hath left off to be wise,
to do good.

verses.plain: He deviseth mischief upon his bed; he setteth himself in a way that is not good; he abhorreth not evil.

tokens.t: He deviseth mischief upon his bed; he setteth himself in a way
not good; he abhorreth not evil.

verses.plain: Thy mercy, O LORD, is in the heavens; and thy faithfulness reacheth unto the clouds.

tokens.t: Thy mercy, O
in the heavens;
thy faithfulness
unto the clouds.

verses.plain: Thy righteousness is like the great mountains; thy judgments are a great deep: O LORD, thou preservest man and beast.

tokens.t: Thy righteousness
like the great mountains; thy judgments
a great deep: O
, thou preservest man and beast.

verses.plain: How excellent is thy lovingkindness, O God! therefore the children of men put their trust under the shadow of thy wings.

tokens.t: How excellent
thy lovingkindness, O God! therefore the children of men put their trust under the shadow of thy wings.

verses.plain: They shall be abundantly satisfied with the fatness of thy house; and thou shalt make them drink of the river of thy pleasures.

tokens.t: They shall be abundantly satisfied with the fatness of thy house; and thou shalt make them drink of the river of thy pleasures.

verses.plain: For with thee is the fountain of life: in thy light shall we see light.

tokens.t: For with thee
the fountain of life: in thy light shall we see light.

verses.plain: O continue thy lovingkindness unto them that know thee; and thy righteousness to the upright in heart.

tokens.t: O continue thy lovingkindness unto them that know thee; and thy righteousness to the upright in heart.

verses.plain: Let not the foot of pride come against me, and let not the hand of the wicked remove me.

tokens.t: Let not the foot of pride come against me, and let not the hand of the wicked remove me.

verses.plain: There are the workers of iniquity fallen: they are cast down, and shall not be able to rise.

tokens.t: There are the workers of iniquity fallen: they are cast down, and shall not be able to rise.

footnotes.text: until…: Heb. to find his iniquity to hate
the…: Heb. the mountains of God
continue: Heb. draw out at length
